articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Investigators from the Corruption Investigation Office for High-ranking Officials and police are probing allegations that Yoon masterminded insurrection.
articles.title: South Korean police asked to execute arrest warrant for impeached president

articles.author: Ammu Kannampilly
articles.description: Charles Owino was killed by a gunshot during protests. Kenya’s police recorded his death as a road accident. Reuters investigates an alleged cover-up of protester killings.
articles.title: How Kenya police hid killings of anti-government protesters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is expected to announce as early as Monday that he will resign as Liberal Party Leader, The Globe and Mail reported on Sunday, citing three sources.
articles.title: Canada PM Trudeau to announce resignation as early as Monday, Globe and Mail reports

articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: China's top diplomat began his annual New Year tour of Africa on Sunday, maintaining a 35-year-long tradition, to quietly advance Beijing's already sizeable influence across the resource-rich continent as Europe's presence wanes and America's wavers.
articles.title: China's top diplomat heads to Africa as West's attention dwindles

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said security guarantees for Kyiv to end Russia's war would only be effective if the United States provides them, and that he hoped to meet U.S. President-elect Donald Trump soon after his inauguration.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says Kyiv security guarantees will only work if US provides them

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea fired a ballistic missile out to sea off its east coast on Monday, coinciding with a visit by U.S Secretary of State Antony Blinken to Seoul during a period of political turmoil in South Korea.
articles.title: North Korea fires ballistic missile as Blinken visits Seoul

articles.author: Tom Bergin
articles.description: When the deadly Grenfell Tower blaze in 2017 led to revelations that high-rise public housing buildings across Britain were wrapped in flammable cladding, the government vowed the building contractors responsible would pay for their negligence.
articles.title: Exclusive: The Ghosts of Grenfell: No penalties for UK firms that used deadly building material

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy will go on trial on Monday charged with receiving millions of euros in illegal financing from Libya's late strongman Muammar Gaddafi for his successful 2007 presidential bid.
articles.title: France's Sarkozy goes on trial over alleged Libyan campaign financing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 10 policemen were feared killed in a bomb blast in the central Indian state of Chhattisgarh, television news channel CNN News18 reported on Monday.
articles.title: Ten policemen feared killed in bomb blast in central India, TV report says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of Uganda's military, who is also the son of longstanding President Yoweri Museveni, said he wanted to behead the country's most prominent opposition leader.
articles.title: Uganda's military head says he wants to behead opposition leader
